Package me.philcali.device.pool.lock

Class LocalLockingMechanism

  • java.lang.Object
    • me.philcali.device.pool.lock.LocalLockingMechanism
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    LockingMechanism
    public class LocalLockingMechanism
extends Object
implements LockingMechanism
    A LockingMechanism that is entirely local and in-memory. It wraps a ConcurrentHashMap for held locks. The purpose of this LockingMechanism is to facilitate integration for using the mechanism in lock decorations like the LockingService or LockingProvisionService
    Version:
    $Id: $Id
    Author:
    philcali

      • lock

        public CompletableFuture<LockOutput> lock​(LockInput input)
        Attempts to acquire a lock on the unique identifier, which is included as the id of the LockInput.
        Specified by:
        lock in interface LockingMechanism
        Parameters:
        input - The lock information for the LockingMechanism to hold on to
        Returns:
        A CompletableFuture that results in a LockOutput when successfully acquires a lock

      • lease

        public void lease​(String lockId)
           throws LockingException
        Forcibly releases the lock that may or may not be held by the client.
        Specified by:
        lease in interface LockingMechanism
        Parameters:
        lockId - The unique lock identifier to release
        Throws:
        LockingException - Failure to release the lock being held

      • extend

        public LockOutput extend​(LockInput input)
                  throws LockingException
        Attempts to extend the lock that is in the client control. An attempt to extend a lock that is not in the client control will result in a conflict, surfaced as a LockingConflictException
        Specified by:
        extend in interface LockingMechanism
        Parameters:
        input - The lock information held by the client in the form of a LockInput
        Returns:
        The updated lock metadata in the form of a LockOutput
        Throws:
        LockingException - Failure to extend the lock
